verses.t: The word{H1697} that Jeremiah{H3414} the prophet{H5030} spake{H1696} unto Baruch{H1263} the son{H1121} of Neriah{H5374}, when he had written{H3789} these words{H1697} in a book{H5612} at the mouth{H6310} of Jeremiah{H3414}, in the fourth{H7243} year{H8141} of Jehoiakim{H3079} the son{H1121} of Josiah{H2977} king{H4428} of Judah{H3063}, saying{H559},
Thus saith{H559} Lordthe {H3068}, the God{H430} of Israel{H3478}, unto thee, O Baruch{H1263};
Thou didst say{H559}, Woe{H188} Lordis me now! for the {H3068} hath added{H3254} grief{H3015} to my sorrow{H4341}; I fainted{H3021} in my sighing{H585}, and I find{H4672} no rest{H4496}.

Thus shalt thou say{H559} Lordunto him, The {H3068} saith{H559} thus; Behold, that which I have built{H1129} will I break down{H2040}, and that which I have planted{H5193} I will pluck up{H5428}, even this whole land{H776}.

And seekest{H1245} thou great things{H1419} for thyself? seek{H1245} them not: for, behold, I will bring{H935} evil{H7451} upon all flesh{H1320}, saith{H5002} Lordthe {H3068}: but thy life{H5315} will I give{H5414} unto thee for a prey{H7998} in all places{H4725} whither thou goest{H3212}.
